revised_title: Magnetic Observations in Hudson's Bay and the Reversal of Isogonic Lines
tldr: Major-General Sabine analyzes magnetic observations made by Lieut. Blakiston at York Fort in Hudson's Bay in 1857. The results confirm the accuracy of previous magnetic force values and reveal a reversal in the direction of isogonic lines, supporting Halley's hypothesis on the double system of terrestrial magnetic forces.
